Subject: Hyperneat and competitive coevolution?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=190115458; y=WwGtlo5XbRJbRh44UWsmHsMlr2gSWB65uk7agNqD3hcK68AD93Qf-BPr51Ovy0f2XjHjsH_n4DgZ6-k
X-Yahoo-Profile: ze_dakster

Just wondering if there has been any work using hyperneat in
competitive coevolution. It seems like the ability to setup the
substrate to represent the geometric relationships of inputs would
prove beneficial in more complex competitive coevolutionary problem
domains.

I'm not particularly familiar with hyperneat, and I might just be
searching for the wrong keywords. Anyone aware of any work in that
area?



-Drew
